wine.name: Cava

properties.residualsugar: Brut Nature, Extra Brut, Brut, Semi Seco

wine.foodpairing: Tapas and paella, but also amazing with Mexican food and get this, red bean chili
wine.tastingnotes: Quince, Lime, TYellow Apple, Chamomile and Almond

wine.name: Champagne

properties.residualsugar: Brut Nature, Extra Brut, Brut, Extra Druy, Dry, Demi-Sec, Doux

wine.foodpairing: Just about anything that’s salty, fried or fishy
wine.tastingnotes: Citrus (Meyer lemon), yellow pomaceous fruits (like yellow pear and apple), cream, almond and toast

wine.name: Proseco
wine.foodpairing: Antipasto, cured meats, almonds. It’s also a natural pairing with spicy Asian food
wine.tastingnotes: CGreen Apple, honeydew, pear, lager and cream,

wine.name: Chardonnay
wine.foodpairing: Lobster, crab, shrimp, chicken, pork, mushroom, French, cream sauces, soft cheeses such as triple cream brie, medium-firm cheeses like Gruyère
wine.tastingnotes: Yellow citrus (Meyer lemon), yellow pomaceous fruits (like yellow pear and apple), tropical fruits (banana, pineapple), and often a touch of butterscotch, vanilla or toasted caramel notes from oak

wine.name: Sauvignon Blanc
wine.foodpairing: Fish, chicken, pork, veal, Mexican, Vietnamese, French, herb-crusted goat cheese, nutty cheeses such as Gruyère
wine.tastingnotes: Aggressively-citrus-driven (grapefruit pith), with some exotic fruits (honeydew melon, passion fruit, kiwi) and always an herbaceous quality (grass, mint, green pepper)

wine.name: Pinot Gris
wine.foodpairing: Salad, delicate poached fish, light and mild cheeses
wine.tastingnotes: Delicate citrus (lime water, orange zest) and pomaceous fruits (apple skin, pear sauce), white floral notes, and cheese rind (from lees usage)
